member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan
member.summary: Defines the Native Wifi API through P/Invoke interop.
member.remarks: This class is intended for internal use. Use the class instead.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanScan(System.IntPtr,System.Guid,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.param: Not supported on Windows XP SP2: must be a null reference.
Not supported on Windows XP SP2: must be a null reference.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanGetProfile(System.IntPtr,System.Guid,System.String,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr@,NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanProfileFlags@,NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAccess@)
member.param: Not supported on Windows XP SP2: must be a null reference.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.Wlan.ThrowIfError(System.Int32)
member.summary: Helper method to wrap calls to Native WiFi API methods. If the method falls, throws an exception containing the error code.
member.param: The error code.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode
member.summary: Defines various opcodes used to set and query parameters for an interface.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the native WLAN_INTF_OPCODE type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode.AutoconfEnabled
member.summary: Opcode used to set or query whether auto config is enabled.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode.BackgroundScanEnabled
member.summary: Opcode used to set or query whether background scan is enabled.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode.MediaStreamingMode
member.summary: Opcode used to set or query the media streaming mode of the driver.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode.RadioState
member.summary: Opcode used to set or query the radio state.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode.BssType
member.summary: Opcode used to set or query the BSS type of the interface.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode.InterfaceState
member.summary: Opcode used to query the state of the interface.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode.CurrentConnection
member.summary: Opcode used to query information about the current connection of the interface.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode.ChannelNumber
member.summary: Opcose used to query the current channel on which the wireless interface is operating.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode.SupportedInfrastructureAuthCipherPairs
member.summary: Opcode used to query the supported auth/cipher pairs for infrastructure mode.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode.SupportedAdhocAuthCipherPairs
member.summary: Opcode used to query the supported auth/cipher pairs for ad hoc mode.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode.SupportedCountryOrRegionStringList
member.summary: Opcode used to query the list of supported country or region strings.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode.CurrentOperationMode
member.summary: Opcode used to set or query the current operation mode of the wireless interface.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode.Statistics
member.summary: Opcode used to query driver statistics.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode.RSSI
member.summary: Opcode used to query the received signal strength.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanOpcodeValueType
member.summary: Specifies the origin of automatic configuration (auto config) settings.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the native WLAN_OPCODE_VALUE_TYPE type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanOpcodeValueType.QueryOnly
member.summary: The auto config settings were queried, but the origin of the settings was not determined.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanOpcodeValueType.SetByGroupPolicy
member.summary: The auto config settings were set by group policy.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanOpcodeValueType.SetByUser
member.summary: The auto config settings were set by the user.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanOpcodeValueType.Invalid
member.summary: The auto config settings are invalid.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanGetAvailableNetworkFlags
member.summary: Defines flags passed to .

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanGetAvailableNetworkFlags.IncludeAllAdhocProfiles
member.summary: Include all ad-hoc network profiles in the available network list, including profiles that are not visible.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanGetAvailableNetworkFlags.IncludeAllManualHiddenProfiles
member.summary: Include all hidden network profiles in the available network list, including profiles that are not visible.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetworkListHeader
member.summary: The header of an array of information about available networks.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetworkListHeader.numberOfItems
member.summary: Contains the number of items following the header.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetworkListHeader.index
member.summary: The index of the current item. The index of the first item is 0.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetworkFlags
member.summary: Contains various flags for the network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetworkFlags.Connected
member.summary: This network is currently connected.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetworkFlags.HasProfile
member.summary: There is a profile for this network.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork
member.summary: Contains information about an available wireless network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.profileName
member.summary: Contains the profile name associated with the network. If the network doesn't have a profile, this member will be empty. If multiple profiles are associated with the network, there will be multiple entries with the same SSID in the visible network list. Profile names are case-sensitive.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.dot11Ssid
member.summary: Contains the SSID of the visible wireless network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.dot11BssType
member.summary: Specifies whether the network is infrastructure or ad hoc.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.numberOfBssids
member.summary: Indicates the number of BSSIDs in the network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.networkConnectable
member.summary: Indicates whether the network is connectable or not.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.wlanNotConnectableReason
member.summary: Indicates why a network cannot be connected to. This member is only valid when is false.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.numberOfPhyTypes
member.summary: The number of PHY types supported on available networks. The maximum value of this field is 8. If more than 8 PHY types are supported, must be set to true.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.dot11PhyTypes
member.summary: Contains an array of values that represent the PHY types supported by the available networks. When is greater than 8, this array contains only the first 8 PHY types.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.morePhyTypes
member.summary: Specifies if there are more than 8 PHY types supported. When this member is set to true, an application must call to get the complete list of PHY types. contains the PHY type for an entry.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.wlanSignalQuality
member.summary: A percentage value that represents the signal quality of the network. This field contains a value between 0 and 100. A value of 0 implies an actual RSSI signal strength of -100 dbm. A value of 100 implies an actual RSSI signal strength of -50 dbm. You can calculate the RSSI signal strength value for values between 1 and 99 using linear interpolation.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.securityEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether security is enabled on the network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.dot11DefaultAuthAlgorithm
member.summary: Indicates the default authentication algorithm used to join this network for the first time.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.dot11DefaultCipherAlgorithm
member.summary: Indicates the default cipher algorithm to be used when joining this network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.flags
member.summary: Contains various flags for the network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.reserved
member.summary: Reserved for future use. Must be set to NULL.

member.name: P:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.Dot11PhyTypes
member.summary: Gets the values that represent the PHY types supported by the available networks.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanProfileFlags.AllUser
member.remarks: The only option available on Windows XP SP2.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAccess
member.summary: Defines the access mask of an all-user profile.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAccess.ReadAccess
member.summary: The user can view profile permissions.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAccess.ExecuteAccess
member.summary: The user has read access, and the user can also connect to and disconnect from a network using the profile.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAccess.WriteAccess
member.summary: The user has execute access and the user can also modify and delete permissions associated with a profile.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanNotificationSource
member.summary: Specifies where the notification comes from.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanNotificationSource.All
member.summary: All notifications, including those generated by the 802.1X module.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanNotificationSource.ACM
member.summary: Notifications generated by the auto configuration module.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanNotificationSource.MSM
member.summary: Notifications generated by MSM.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanNotificationSource.Security
member.summary: Notifications generated by the security module.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanNotificationSource.IHV
member.summary: Notifications generated by independent hardware vendors (IHV).

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanNotificationCodeAcm
member.summary: Indicates the type of an ACM () notification.
member.remarks: The enumeration identifiers correspond to the native wlan_notification_acm_ identifiers. On Windows XP SP2, only the ConnectionComplete and Disconnected notifications are available.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanNotificationCodeMsm
member.summary: Indicates the type of an MSM () notification.
member.remarks: The enumeration identifiers correspond to the native wlan_notification_msm_ identifiers.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanNotificationData
member.summary: Contains information provided when registering for notifications.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the native WLAN_NOTIFICATION_DATA type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanNotificationData.notificationSource
member.summary: Specifies where the notification comes from.
member.remarks: On Windows XP SP2, this field must be set to , or .

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanNotificationData.notificationCode
member.summary: Indicates the type of notification. The value of this field indicates what type of associated data will be present in .

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanNotificationData.interfaceGuid
member.summary: Indicates which interface the notification is for.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanNotificationData.dataSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of , in bytes.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanNotificationData.dataPtr
member.summary: Pointer to additional data needed for the notification, as indicated by .

member.name: P:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanNotificationData.NotificationCode
member.summary: Gets the notification code (in the correct enumeration type) according to the notification source.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanNotificationCallbackDelegate
member.summary: Defines the callback function which accepts WLAN notifications.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionFlags
member.summary: Defines connection parameter flags.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionFlags.HiddenNetwork
member.summary:
Connect to the destination network even if the destination is a hidden network. A hidden network does not broadcast its SSID. Do not use this flag if the destination network is an ad-hoc network.
If the profile specified by is not null, then this flag is ignored and the nonBroadcast profile element determines whether to connect to a hidden network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionFlags.AdhocJoinOnly
member.summary: Do not form an ad-hoc network. Only join an ad-hoc network if the network already exists. Do not use this flag if the destination network is an infrastructure network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionFlags.IgnorePrivacyBit
member.summary: Ignore the privacy bit when connecting to the network. Ignoring the privacy bit has the effect of ignoring whether packets are encryption and ignoring the method of encryption used. Only use this flag when connecting to an infrastructure network using a temporary profile.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionFlags.EapolPassthrough
member.summary: Exempt EAPOL traffic from encryption and decryption. This flag is used when an application must send EAPOL traffic over an infrastructure network that uses Open authentication and WEP encryption. This flag must not be used to connect to networks that require 802.1X authentication. This flag is only valid when is set to . Avoid using this flag whenever possible.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionParameters
member.summary: Specifies the parameters used when using the function.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the native WLAN_CONNECTION_PARAMETERS type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionParameters.wlanConnectionMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode of connection.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionParameters.profile
member.summary:
Specifies the profile being used for the connection. The contents of the field depend on the :
Value of Contents of the profile string
The name of the profile used for the connection.
The XML representation of the profile used for the connection.
, or null

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionParameters.dot11SsidPtr
member.summary: Pointer to a structure that specifies the SSID of the network to connect to. This field is optional. When set to null, all SSIDs in the profile will be tried. This field must not be null if is set to or .

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionParameters.desiredBssidListPtr
member.summary: Pointer to a structure that contains the list of basic service set (BSS) identifiers desired for the connection.
member.remarks: On Windows XP SP2, must be set to null.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionParameters.dot11BssType
member.summary: A value that indicates the BSS type of the network. If a profile is provided, this BSS type must be the same as the one in the profile.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionParameters.flags
member.summary: Specifies ocnnection parameters.
member.remarks: On Windows XP SP2, must be set to 0.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAdhocNetworkState
member.summary: The connection state of an ad hoc network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAdhocNetworkState.Formed
member.summary: The ad hoc network has been formed, but no client or host is connected to the network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAdhocNetworkState.Connected
member.summary: A client or host is connected to the ad hoc network.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanBssEntry
member.summary: Contains information about a basic service set (BSS).

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanBssEntry.dot11Ssid
member.summary: Contains the SSID of the access point (AP) associated with the BSS.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanBssEntry.phyId
member.summary: The identifier of the PHY on which the AP is operating.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanBssEntry.dot11Bssid
member.summary: Contains the BSS identifier.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanBssEntry.dot11BssType
member.summary: Specifies whether the network is infrastructure or ad hoc.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanBssEntry.rssi
member.summary: The received signal strength in dBm.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanBssEntry.linkQuality
member.summary: The link quality reported by the driver. Ranges from 0-100.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanBssEntry.inRegDomain
member.summary: If 802.11d is not implemented, the network interface card (NIC) must set this field to TRUE. If 802.11d is implemented (but not necessarily enabled), the NIC must set this field to TRUE if the BSS operation complies with the configured regulatory domain.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanBssEntry.beaconPeriod
member.summary: Contains the beacon interval value from the beacon packet or probe response.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanBssEntry.timestamp
member.summary: The timestamp from the beacon packet or probe response.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanBssEntry.hostTimestamp
member.summary: The host timestamp value when the beacon or probe response is received.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanBssEntry.capabilityInformation
member.summary: The capability value from the beacon packet or probe response.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanBssEntry.chCenterFrequency
member.summary: The frequency of the center channel, in kHz.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanBssEntry.wlanRateSet
member.summary: Contains the set of data transfer rates supported by the BSS.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanBssEntry.ieOffset
member.summary: Offset of the information element (IE) data blob.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanBssEntry.ieSize
member.summary: Size of the IE data blob, in bytes.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanRateSet
member.summary: Contains the set of supported data rates.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanRateSet.rateSetLength
member.summary: The length, in bytes, of .

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanRateSet.rateSet
member.summary: An array of supported data transfer rates. If the rate is a basic rate, the first bit of the rate value is set to 1. A basic rate is the data transfer rate that all stations in a basic service set (BSS) can use to receive frames from the wireless medium.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanRateSet.GetRateInMbps(System.Int32)
member.summary: CalculateS the data transfer rate in Mbps for an arbitrary supported rate.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanException
member.summary: Represents an error occuring during WLAN operations which indicate their failure via a .

member.name: P:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanException.ReasonCode
member.summary: Gets the WLAN reason code.

member.name: P:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanException.Message
member.summary: Gets a message that describes the reason code.
member.returns: The error message that explains the reason for the exception, or an empty string("").

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanReasonCode
member.summary: Specifies reasons for a failure of a WLAN operation.
member.remarks: To get the WLAN API native reason code identifiers, prefix the identifiers with WLAN_REASON_CODE_.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionNotificationData
member.summary: Contains information about connection related notifications.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the native WLAN_CONNECTION_NOTIFICATION_DATA type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionNotificationData.wlanConnectionMode
member.remarks: On Windows XP SP 2, only is supported.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionNotificationData.profileName
member.summary: The name of the profile used for the connection. Profile names are case-sensitive.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionNotificationData.dot11Ssid
member.summary: The SSID of the association.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionNotificationData.dot11BssType
member.summary: The BSS network type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionNotificationData.securityEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether security is enabled for this connection.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionNotificationData.wlanReasonCode
member.summary: Indicates the reason for an operation failure. This field has a value of for all connection-related notifications except . If the connection fails, this field indicates the reason for the failure.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionNotificationData.profileXml
member.summary: This field contains the XML presentation of the profile used for discovery, if the connection succeeds.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanInterfaceState
member.summary: Indicates the state of an interface.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the native WLAN_INTERFACE_STATE type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanInterfaceState.NotReady
member.summary: The interface is not ready to operate.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanInterfaceState.Connected
member.summary: The interface is connected to a network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanInterfaceState.AdHocNetworkFormed
member.summary: The interface is the first node in an ad hoc network. No peer has connected.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanInterfaceState.Disconnecting
member.summary: The interface is disconnecting from the current network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanInterfaceState.Disconnected
member.summary: The interface is not connected to any network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanInterfaceState.Associating
member.summary: The interface is attempting to associate with a network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanInterfaceState.Discovering
member.summary: Auto configuration is discovering the settings for the network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanInterfaceState.Authenticating
member.summary: The interface is in the process of authenticating.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11Ssid
member.summary: Contains the SSID of an interface.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11Ssid.SSIDLength
member.summary: The length, in bytes, of the array.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11Ssid.SSID
member.summary: The SSID.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11PhyType
member.summary: Defines an 802.11 PHY and media type.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the native DOT11_PHY_TYPE type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11PhyType.Unknown
member.summary: Specifies an unknown or uninitialized PHY type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11PhyType.Any
member.summary: Specifies any PHY type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11PhyType.FHSS
member.summary: Specifies a frequency-hopping spread-spectrum (FHSS) PHY. Bluetooth devices can use FHSS or an adaptation of FHSS.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11PhyType.DSSS
member.summary: Specifies a direct sequence spread spectrum (DSSS) PHY.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11PhyType.IrBaseband
member.summary: Specifies an infrared (IR) baseband PHY.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11PhyType.OFDM
member.summary: Specifies an orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (OFDM) PHY. 802.11a devices can use OFDM.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11PhyType.HRDSSS
member.summary: Specifies a high-rate DSSS (HRDSSS) PHY.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11PhyType.ERP
member.summary: Specifies an extended rate PHY (ERP). 802.11g devices can use ERP.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11PhyType.IHV_Start
member.summary: Specifies the start of the range that is used to define PHY types that are developed by an independent hardware vendor (IHV).

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11PhyType.IHV_End
member.summary: Specifies the end of the range that is used to define PHY types that are developed by an independent hardware vendor (IHV).

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11BssType
member.summary: Defines a basic service set (BSS) network type.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the native DOT11_BSS_TYPE type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11BssType.Infrastructure
member.summary: Specifies an infrastructure BSS network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11BssType.Independent
member.summary: Specifies an independent BSS (IBSS) network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11BssType.Any
member.summary: Specifies either infrastructure or IBSS network.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAssociationAttributes
member.summary: Contains association attributes for a connection
member.remarks: Corresponds to the native WLAN_ASSOCIATION_ATTRIBUTES type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAssociationAttributes.dot11Ssid
member.summary: The SSID of the association.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAssociationAttributes.dot11BssType
member.summary: Specifies whether the network is infrastructure or ad hoc.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAssociationAttributes.dot11Bssid
member.summary: The BSSID of the association.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAssociationAttributes.dot11PhyType
member.summary: The physical type of the association.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAssociationAttributes.dot11PhyIndex
member.summary: The position of the value in the structure containing the list of PHY types.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAssociationAttributes.wlanSignalQuality
member.summary: A percentage value that represents the signal quality of the network. This field contains a value between 0 and 100. A value of 0 implies an actual RSSI signal strength of -100 dbm. A value of 100 implies an actual RSSI signal strength of -50 dbm. You can calculate the RSSI signal strength value for values between 1 and 99 using linear interpolation.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAssociationAttributes.rxRate
member.summary: The receiving rate of the association.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAssociationAttributes.txRate
member.summary: The transmission rate of the association.

member.name: P:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAssociationAttributes.Dot11Bssid
member.summary: Gets the BSSID of the associated access point.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionMode
member.summary: Defines the mode of connection.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the native WLAN_CONNECTION_MODE type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionMode.Profile
member.summary: A profile will be used to make the connection.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionMode.TemporaryProfile
member.summary: A temporary profile will be used to make the connection.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionMode.DiscoverySecure
member.summary: Secure discovery will be used to make the connection.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionMode.DiscoveryUnsecure
member.summary: Unsecure discovery will be used to make the connection.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionMode.Auto
member.summary: A connection will be made automatically, generally using a persistent profile.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionMode.Invalid
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm
member.summary: Defines a wireless LAN authentication algorithm.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the native DOT11_AUTH_ALGORITHM type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.IEEE80211_Open
member.summary: Specifies an IEEE 802.11 Open System authentication algorithm.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.IEEE80211_SharedKey
member.summary: Specifies an 802.11 Shared Key authentication algorithm that requires the use of a pre-shared Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) key for the 802.11 authentication.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.WPA
member.summary:
Specifies a Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA) algorithm. IEEE 802.1X port authentication is performed by the supplicant, authenticator, and authentication server. Cipher keys are dynamically derived through the authentication process.
This algorithm is valid only for BSS types of .
When the WPA algorithm is enabled, the 802.11 station will associate only with an access point whose beacon or probe responses contain the authentication suite of type 1 (802.1X) within the WPA information element (IE).

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.WPA_PSK
member.summary:
Specifies a WPA algorithm that uses preshared keys (PSK). IEEE 802.1X port authentication is performed by the supplicant and authenticator. Cipher keys are dynamically derived through a preshared key that is used on both the supplicant and authenticator.
This algorithm is valid only for BSS types of .
When the WPA PSK algorithm is enabled, the 802.11 station will associate only with an access point whose beacon or probe responses contain the authentication suite of type 2 (preshared key) within the WPA IE.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.WPA_None
member.summary: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.RSNA
member.summary:
Specifies an 802.11i Robust Security Network Association (RSNA) algorithm. WPA2 is one such algorithm. IEEE 802.1X port authentication is performed by the supplicant, authenticator, and authentication server. Cipher keys are dynamically derived through the authentication process.
This algorithm is valid only for BSS types of .
When the RSNA algorithm is enabled, the 802.11 station will associate only with an access point whose beacon or probe responses contain the authentication suite of type 1 (802.1X) within the RSN IE.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.RSNA_PSK
member.summary:
Specifies an 802.11i RSNA algorithm that uses PSK. IEEE 802.1X port authentication is performed by the supplicant and authenticator. Cipher keys are dynamically derived through a preshared key that is used on both the supplicant and authenticator.
This algorithm is valid only for BSS types of .
When the RSNA PSK algorithm is enabled, the 802.11 station will associate only with an access point whose beacon or probe responses contain the authentication suite of type 2(preshared key) within the RSN IE.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.IHV_Start
member.summary: Indicates the start of the range that specifies proprietary authentication algorithms that are developed by an IHV.
member.remarks: This enumerator is valid only when the miniport driver is operating in Extensible Station (ExtSTA) mode.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.IHV_End
member.summary: Indicates the end of the range that specifies proprietary authentication algorithms that are developed by an IHV.
member.remarks: This enumerator is valid only when the miniport driver is operating in Extensible Station (ExtSTA) mode.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm
member.summary: Defines a cipher algorithm for data encryption and decryption.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the native DOT11_CIPHER_ALGORITHM type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.None
member.summary: Specifies that no cipher algorithm is enabled or supported.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.WEP40
member.summary: Specifies a Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) algorithm, which is the RC4-based algorithm that is specified in the 802.11-1999 standard. This enumerator specifies the WEP cipher algorithm with a 40-bit cipher key.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.TKIP
member.summary: Specifies a Temporal Key Integrity Protocol (TKIP) algorithm, which is the RC4-based cipher suite that is based on the algorithms that are defined in the WPA specification and IEEE 802.11i-2004 standard. This cipher also uses the Michael Message Integrity Code (MIC) algorithm for forgery protection.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.CCMP
member.summary: Specifies an AES-CCMP algorithm, as specified in the IEEE 802.11i-2004 standard and RFC 3610. Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) is the encryption algorithm defined in FIPS PUB 197.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.WEP104
member.summary: Specifies a WEP cipher algorithm with a 104-bit cipher key.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.WPA_UseGroup
member.summary: Specifies a Robust Security Network (RSN) Use Group Key cipher suite. For more information about the Use Group Key cipher suite, refer to Clause 7.3.2.9.1 of the IEEE 802.11i-2004 standard.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.RSN_UseGroup
member.summary: Specifies a Wifi Protected Access (WPA) Use Group Key cipher suite. For more information about the Use Group Key cipher suite, refer to Clause 7.3.2.9.1 of the IEEE 802.11i-2004 standard.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.WEP
member.summary: Specifies a WEP cipher algorithm with a cipher key of any length.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.IHV_Start
member.summary: Specifies the start of the range that is used to define proprietary cipher algorithms that are developed by an independent hardware vendor (IHV).

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.IHV_End
member.summary: Specifies the end of the range that is used to define proprietary cipher algorithms that are developed by an IHV.

member.summary: The state of the interface.

member.summary: The mode of the connection.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionAttributes.profileName
member.summary: The name of the profile used for the connection. Profile names are case-sensitive.

member.summary: The attributes of the association.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionAttributes.wlanSecurityAttributes
member.summary: The security attributes of the connection.

member.summary: The header of the list returned by .

member.summary: The header of the list returned by .

member.summary: Contains basic information about a profile.

member.summary: The name of the profile. This value may be the name of a domain if the profile is for provisioning. Profile names are case-sensitive.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanProfileInfo.profileFlags
member.summary: Profile flags.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11OperationMode
member.summary: Flags that specifiy the miniport driver's current operation mode.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11OperationMode.ExtensibleStation
member.summary: Specifies that the miniport driver supports the Extensible Station (ExtSTA) operation mode.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11OperationMode.NetworkMonitor
member.summary: Specifies that the miniport driver supports the Network Monitor (NetMon) operation mode.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.WlanClient
member.summary: Represents a client to the Zeroconf (Native Wifi) service.
member.remarks: This class is the entrypoint to Native Wifi management. To manage WiFi settings, create an instance of this class.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a Native Wifi service client.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.GetStringForReasonCode(NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanReasonCode)
member.summary: Gets a string that describes a specified reason code.
member.param: The reason code.

member.name: P:NativeWifi.WlanClient.Interfaces
member.summary: Gets the WLAN interfaces.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface
member.summary: Represents a Wifi network interface.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.SetInterfaceInt(NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets a parameter of the interface whose data type is .
member.param: The opcode of the parameter.
The value to set.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.GetInterfaceInt(NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanIntfOpcode)
member.summary: Gets a parameter of the interface whose data type is .
member.param: The opcode of the parameter.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.Scan
member.summary: Requests a scan for available networks.
member.remarks: The method returns immediately. Progress is reported through the event.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.ConvertAvailableNetworkListPtr(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Converts a pointer to a available networks list (header + entries) to an array of available network entries.
member.param: A pointer to an available networks list's header.
member.returns: An array of available network entries.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.GetAvailableNetworkList(NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanGetAvailableNetworkFlags)
member.summary: Retrieves the list of available networks.
member.param: Controls the type of networks returned.
member.returns: A list of the available networks.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.ConvertBssListPtr(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Converts a pointer to a BSS list (header + entries) to an array of BSS entries.
member.param: A pointer to a BSS list's header.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.GetNetworkBssList
member.summary: Retrieves the basic service sets (BSS) list of all available networks.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.GetNetworkBssList(NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11Ssid,NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11BssType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the basic service sets (BSS) list of the specified network.
member.param: Specifies the SSID of the network from which the BSS list is requested.
Indicates the BSS type of the network.
Indicates whether security is enabled on the network.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.Connect(NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionParameters)
member.summary: Connects to a network defined by a connection parameters structure.
member.param: The connection paramters.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.Connect(NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionMode,NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11BssType,System.String)
member.summary: Requests a connection (association) to the specified wireless network.
member.remarks: The method returns immediately. Progress is reported through the event.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.ConnectSynchronously(NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionMode,NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11BssType,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Connects (associates) to the specified wireless network, returning either on a success to connect or a failure.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.Connect(NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionMode,NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11BssType,NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11Ssid,NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionFlags)
member.summary: Connects to the specified wireless network.
member.remarks: The method returns immediately. Progress is reported through the event.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.DeleteProfile(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a profile.
member.param: The name of the profile to be deleted. Profile names are case-sensitive. On Windows XP SP2, the supplied name must match the profile name derived automatically from the SSID of the network. For an infrastructure network profile, the SSID must be supplied for the profile name. For an ad hoc network profile, the supplied name must be the SSID of the ad hoc network followed by -adhoc.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.SetProfile(NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanProfileFlags,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the profile.
member.param: The flags to set on the profile.
The XML representation of the profile. On Windows XP SP 2, special care should be taken to adhere to its limitations.
If a profile by the given name already exists, then specifies whether to overwrite it (if true) or return an error (if false).
member.returns: The resulting code indicating a success or the reason why the profile wasn't valid.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.GetProfileXml(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the profile's XML specification.
member.param: The name of the profile.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.GetProfiles
member.summary: Gets the information of all profiles on this interface.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.EnqueueEvent(System.Object)
member.summary: Enqueues a notification event to be processed serially.

member.name: E:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.WlanNotification
member.summary: Occurs when an event of any kind occurs on a WLAN interface.

member.name: E:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.WlanConnectionNotification
member.summary: Occurs when a WLAN interface changes connection state.

member.name: E:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.WlanReasonNotification
member.summary: Occurs when a WLAN operation fails due to some reason.

member.name: P:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.Autoconf
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is automatically configured.
member.value: true if "autoconf" is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.BssType
member.summary: Gets or sets the BSS type for the indicated interface.

member.name: P:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.InterfaceState
member.summary: Gets the state of the interface.

member.name: P:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.Channel
member.summary: Gets the channel.
member.remarks: Not supported on Windows XP SP2.

member.name: P:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.RSSI
member.summary: Gets the RSSI.
member.remarks: Not supported on Windows XP SP2.

member.name: P:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.CurrentOperationMode
member.summary: Gets the current operation mode.
member.remarks: Not supported on Windows XP SP2.

member.name: P:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.CurrentConnection
member.summary: Gets the attributes of the current connection.
member.exception: An exception with code 0x0000139F (The group or resource is not in the correct state to perform the requested operation.) will be thrown if the interface is not connected to a network.

member.name: P:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.NetworkInterface
member.summary: Gets the network interface of this wireless interface.
member.remarks: The network interface allows querying of generic network properties such as the interface's IP address.

member.name: P:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.InterfaceGuid
member.summary: The GUID of the interface (same content as the value).

member.name: P:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.InterfaceDescription
member.summary: The description of the interface. This is a user-immutable string containing the vendor and model name of the adapter.

member.name: P:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.InterfaceName
member.summary: The friendly name given to the interface by the user (e.g. "Local Area Network Connection").
